snippet: Maqsood Faruqi was arrested after investigators found he did not follow the required inspection protocols, the authorities said.
abstract: New York City Investigation Dept announces results of six-month inquiry about terra cotta windowsill that fell from building on Upper West Side and fatally struck 2-year-old girl; faults engineer Maqsood Faruqi, who has been charged with offering false instrument for filing; investigation also revealed hundreds of buildings in city have unaddressed problems regarding filings for inspections.
lead_paragraph: Maqsood Faruqi was arrested after investigators found he did not follow the required inspection protocols, the authorities said.

headline.main: Engineer Accused of Failing to Assess Manhattan Building Where Falling Debris Killed Girl
headline.print_headline: Building Engineer Charged After Girl’s Death
